snippet: Research in Motion on Tuesday finally brought e-mail to its tablet computer, the BlackBerry PlayBook, which initially could send or receive e-mails only by being connected to a BlackBerry phone.
abstract: Research in Motion finally brings e-mail to its tablet computer, the BlackBerry PlayBook; initially, the device could only send or receive e-mails by being connected to a BlackBerry phone; upgrade also allows the PlayBook to run some apps developed for devices that use Google's Android operating system, integrates information and messages from social media sites, and allows for use of BlackBerry phones as a physical keyboard for the tablet through a wireless connection.

headline.main: An E-Mail App Arrives for the BlackBerry Tablet
headline.print_headline: An E-Mail App Arrives For the BlackBerry Tablet

snippet: The company’s results disappointed investors and raised concerns that the P.C. industry remained in a slump.
abstract: Dell Inc issues forecast for fiscal first-quarter revenue below Wall Street's expectations, raising fears that the personal computer industry has not fully emerged from its downturn; net income for the fourth quarter fell 18 percent, to $764 million, or 43 cents a share, compared with $927 million, or 48 cents a share, in the period a year earlier.

headline.main: Dell Earnings and Forecast Fall Short of Wall St. Views
headline.print_headline: Dell Earnings and Forecast Fall Short of Wall St. Views

snippet: Google is currently making a pair of glasses that will be able to stream information to the wearer’s eyes in real time.
abstract: Google is currently making a pair of glasses that will be able to stream information to the wearer’s eyes in real time.

headline.main: Google to Sell Heads-Up Display Glasses by Year's End

snippet: At Danny Meyer’s Shake Shack, which just opened in Brooklyn, service is the star. The food, not so much.
abstract: Pete Wells reviews the Shake Shack restaurant chain, which has multiple locations in New York City.

headline.main: The Burger Remains a Work in Progress
headline.print_headline: The Burger Remains A Work in Progress

snippet: A rumor that Microsoft is releasing an iPad version of its Office software was all over the Web on Tuesday. But Microsoft says it's just not true. A Microsoft spokeswoman said: "The Daily story is based on inaccurate rumors and speculation."
abstract: A rumor that Microsoft is releasing an iPad version of its Office software was all over the Web on Tuesday. But Microsoft says it's just not true. A Microsoft spokeswoman said: "The Daily story is based on inaccurate rumors and speculation."

headline.main: Microsoft Denies Rumor of Office Software for iPad

snippet: A new campaign, concentrating on New York, seeks to raise the profile of BBC America, already available in about 75 million American households.

headline.main: Campaign Promotes BBC America the Beautiful
headline.print_headline: Campaign Promotes BBC America the Beautiful

snippet: In the United States, the chances of seeing someone using a Windows Phone 7 handset seem about as good as spotting a leprechaun riding a unicorn. But you'd have a better chance of seeing one of these elusive devices in Europe, where sales are off ...
abstract: In the United States, the chances of seeing someone using a Windows Phone 7 handset seem about as good as spotting a leprechaun riding a unicorn. But you'd have a better chance of seeing one of these elusive devices in Europe, where sales are off to a good start.

headline.main: Nokia's Windows Phones Get a Good Start in Europe

snippet: Also, the role of the "super PAC" is increasing and the fast-growing scrapbook/social-networking Web site Pinterest announces a change.
abstract: Also, the role of the "super PAC" is increasing and the fast-growing scrapbook/social-networking Web site Pinterest announces a change.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Selling to Voters Online, and Life at an iFactory

snippet: A legal battle over Pretzel Crisps underscores the value of a brand name.
abstract: Legal battle over Princeton Vanguard's Pretzel Crisps with Frito-Lay underscores the value of a brand name; experts and lawyers say the value of simple, easily understood brand names has escalated in the Internet era because consumers are more likely to find such products while doing searches on the Web.

headline.main: Trademarks Take On New Importance in Internet Era
